data.name: nodes
hovertext: Graham Brady
Income Categories
Employment
Fee of £930 received 2 September 2016. Hours: 5 hrs.
Training fee of £155 received on 30 September 2016. Hours: 5 hrs.
Fee of £620 received on 16 January 2017. Hours: 6 hrs.
Fee of £775 received on 14 September 2017. Hours: 5 hrs.

From 19 June 2017 a year I receive £26,000 a year (paid monthly) for my role as Editor of The House Magazine (Dods Parliamentary Services), Level 11, The Shard, 32 London Bridge Rd, London SE1 9
SG. Hours: 10 hrs a month. (Updated 31 May 2015, 13 November 2015 and 3 July 2017)
7 November 2016, received £200 for an article. Hours: 2 hrs.

From 15 June 2015 until 30 June 2017, I received £1,200 a month for my role as Adviser to Relish Networks PLC (formerly UKB Network Ltd), a telecoms service provider, of 5th Floor, 236 Gray’s Inn Road, London WC1
X 8
HB. Expected commitment of 3 hrs a month. (Registered 09 July 2015; updated 03 October 2016 and 3 July 2017)
4 April 2017, received £188 from Nashville Care Council, 211 Commerce St # 100, Nashville, TN 37201, USA, for delivering a lecture on 31 March 2017. Hours: 45 mins.

3 April 2017, received £2,000 from New York College, 38 Amalias Avenue, 105 58 Athens, Greece, for giving a lecture in Athens on 5 April 2017, followed by various meetings with Greek parliamentarians and business leaders. Hours: 3 hrs. Between 3 and 7 April 2017, New York College also provided travel and accommodation for my spouse and myself, with an approx. value of £1,500.

Misc Categories
Miscellaneous
I have been given honorary membership of the Carlton Club for the tenure of my position of Chairman of the 1922 Committee.
From 29 September 2015, member of the Hamblin Educational Trust, a multi-academy trust based at Altrincham Grammar School For Boys. This is an unpaid role.
From 20 September 2016, unpaid Director of the Centre for Policy Studies; an independent think tank.
Family
I employ my wife, Victoria Lowther, as Senior Research/Parliamentary Assistant.
